result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan Edward DeVore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan Edward DeVore

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
01:10 PM Bryan Edward DeVore appeared by video means.  Also appearing is Agent Darianne Thomas by video.  
Court reviews restitution payments and questions defendant.  Defendant states he just lost job and is looking for another one.  Court reviews notes from last hearing.  Agent Thomas makes statement.  Court questions defendant.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will extend probation for an additional year and finds he has not made a good faith effort.  Court also orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  That is to commence within the next 60 days.  If he pays the $1,000.00, he will not have to serve that sentence.  Agent to submit paperwork with that condition.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on September 21, 2021 at 01:00 pm.
Probation review hearing on September 21, 2021 at 01:00 pm.
Financial info as requested by Judge Slate from DOC

01:48 PM Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore appeared by phone means. 
14CF73 & 14CF100
Court questions defendant.  Defendant states he pays monthly on his cases.  Court notes 14CF73 is court obligations only and 14CF100 has over $14,000 in restitution still due.  Defendant states he was unemployed for some time and some time that he wasn't checking in with his agent.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will extend probation for a period of 1 year.  Defendant has not made a good faith effort.  If defendant does not pay $1,000.00 in the next year, Court will order 60 days jail with huber.  Court will review this matter in 1 year.
Probation review hearing on October 13, 2020 at 01:45 pm.
Motion hearing on October 13, 2020 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
01:10 PM Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF100 and 14CF73 tracking:
Agent Katie Suwyn also appears in court.  Defendant still owes a lot of money and has cases in Adams County as well that he is paying on.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will extend the defendant's probation for 1 year.
Pay $100 monthly; for every month that he doesn't pay, he will serve 10 days in jail.
Agent Suwyn will prepare the order

02:27 PM Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore not in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Ashley appears by telephone in court.
14CF100 and 14CF73 tracking:
Court questions the Agent.  Agent states that he was absconding for some time and that is why the extension is requested.  Agent thought that the defendant would be here today and is unsure as of why he isn't.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant issued; stay until next Tuesday
Probation review hearing on September 24, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF73, 14CF100 & 15CM44 tracking together:
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 in 14CF73 to Burglary of a Building or Dwelling.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1 in 14CF73, Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF100 and Ct. 1 in 15CM44.  Atty Hendee states that the parties will not be requesting a PSI.
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 14CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Lawton agrees and enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of amended Ct. 1 in 14CF73, Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF100 and Ct. 1 in 15CM44.  
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 14CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Lawton states that the defendant is not requesting a PSI.  Defendant agrees.
  State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Atty Hendee gives a victim impact statement to the both counsel and the court for 14CF100 and 15CM44.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.


BY THE COURT:  14CF73 - amended Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions; concurrent to each other
*Defendant is to have full time employment or provide work searches as required by the Agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $268 
*40 hours community service
*Restitution = $962.50; joint and several as stated in the supplement
*Defendant is to establish a payment plan with the Agent for Restitution

14CF100 - Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions; concurrent to each other
*Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Report forthwith
*May transfer to Adams County
*Defendant is to have full time employment or provide work searches as required by the Agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $268 
*40 hours community service
*Restitution = $21,043.24; joint & several as stated in the supplement
*Defendant is to establish a payment plan with the Agent for Restitution
Credit = 0
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 in 14CF100 to be dismissed and read-in.

15CM44 - Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions; concurrent to each other
*Defendant is to have full time employment or provide work searches as required by the Agent
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $243.00 on the Misd. charge
*40 hours community service
*Restitution = $1,916.14
*Defendant is to establish a payment plan with the Agent for Restitution

Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
**15CM44, 14CF73 & 14CF100 tracking together.
Atty Lawton asks that these matters be set for Plea/Sentencing.

BY THE COURT: Set for Plea/Sentencing.
bond continued.
*See full notes in 15CM44  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Warrant satisfied; defendant appeared in court.
Next Hearing:  April 1, 2015 at 2:30pm
Return date on April 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Lawton states that the Defendant received a copy of the information in 14CF100 & waives the reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant for both cases.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant in 14CF73 & 14CF100.
Set for Return.

Atty Hendee files the information now in 14CF73.
Atty Lawton did receive that information.

Atty Hendee states that a bond has not been set on 14CF100 and asks for a $500 cash bond.
Atty Lawton does not object.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond; no conditions requested.

Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Bryan Edward DeVore in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF73 & 14CF100:
Atty Hendee filed an amended criminal complaint adding 5 new counts in 14CF100.
 Atty Lawton states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint in 14CF73 and the amended criminal complaint in 14CF100 & waives it's reading.  
Atty Lawton states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing for both cases.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Both cases bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information for 14CF100.  Atty Hendee did not print out the information in 14CF73 and asks to get that by the end of today.  Atty Lawton has no objection to that.  
  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on February 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
